Hungary was a hotspot for illegal Chinese immigrants between 1990 and 1992 because after the collapse of the communist bloc it was the only major European country that granted visa free entry for Chinese citizens. Hungary abolished it in 1992 after the massive number of illegal immigrants (50000 at its highest).
